message.content:
cs.HC, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL 

The paper explores the concept of engagement in human-robot interactions, which is a topic that falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also describes the architecture of a robot that can participate in conversational, collaborative interactions, which falls under the category of robotics (cs.RO). The use of tracking faces during an interaction suggests the involvement of computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) techniques. Finally, the paper reports on experiments with human participants, which suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) in designing the robot's engagement gestures.
